isis.stitle: Electrical System Troubleshooting Guide - BE 200, CE 200, CE 300 Model - BODY FEATURES - Service Door Controls - Electric Service Door Fault Detection Management

svcproc.title: Electric Service Door Fault Detection Management

note.para: The testing method for troubleshooting the electrical systems portrayed in this manual is a basic voltage test. An alternative method of checking for voltage drops within a given circuit may be a quicker method of identifying an exact problem.

figure.caption: Electric Service Door Control Circuits (Outputs from ESC to Door Motor) - Always Refer to the Circuit Diagram Book for Latest Circuit Information

calloutgroup.callout1: (1007) BODY BUILDER CONNECTOR LOCATED AT LEFT SIDE VEHICLE AT FLASHER PLATE
(1600) (1602) SYSTEM CONTROLLER CONNECTOR LOCATED AT INSIDE RIGHT SIDE DASH PANEL
CPC3 DASH AND TOE HARNESS TO SEALED ENGINE HARNESS
J2 FLASHER PLATE TO DASH
J17 FLASHER PLATE TO LEFT HAND BODY
J21 LEFT HAND BODY TO FRONT CAP
J140 FLASHER PLATE TO DASH AND TOE
J183 STEP LIGHT OPTIONS
SS4 SEALED ENGINE HARNESS TO STEP LIGHT
SS13 SEALED ENGINE HARNESS TO SKIRT LIGHT

para.emph: Electric Service Door Open Relay Voltage Checks

entry.para: Check with key in ignition switch position on, electric service door controls set to close, open relay removed and all other relays installed.

note.para: Always check connectors for damage and pushed-out terminals.
Always use breakout box ZTSE 4477 to take measurements on ESC connectors.

entry.para: Bench check relay. If relay fails, replace and check for faults.
If voltage is missing check for blown fuse #30 and for open or short on circuit 16 BLK 32.
If voltage is present, check for short on circuits 16 WHT 32 and A89EE.
With voltmeter still connected to open relay socket cavity 86 to 85, open electric service door by activating open electric service control circuits.
If voltage is missing check for open or short on circuits 16 WHT 32 and A89EE.
Also ensure proper signal from system controller (1600) pin 11.

note.para: Always use breakout box ZTSE 4477 to take measurements on ESC connectors.

entry.para: If voltage is missing check blown fuse #30. Also check for open or short on circuit 16 BLK 32.
If voltage is missing check for open or short on circuit 16 BLU 5.
Also ensure proper grounding of electric service door motor.
If circuits check good and door fails to open, replace service door motor.

para.emph: Electric Service Door Closed Relay Voltage Checks

entry.para: Check with key in ignition switch position on, electric service door controls set to open, closed relay removed and all other relays installed.

note.para: Always check connectors for damage and pushed-out terminals.
Always use breakout box ZTSE 4477 to take measurements on ESC connectors.

entry.para: Bench check relay. If relay fails, replace and check for faults.
If voltage is missing check for blown fuse #30 and for open or short on circuit 16 BLK 32.
If voltage is present, check for short on circuits 16 WHT 33 and A89AP.
With voltmeter still connected to closed relay socket cavity 86 to 85, active closed service door circuits by pressing the close service door button.
If voltage is missing check for open or short on circuits 16 WHT 33 and A89AP.
Also ensure proper signal from system controller (1602) pin 17.

note.para: Always use breakout box ZTSE 4477 to take measurements on ESC connectors.

entry.para: If voltage is missing check blown fuse #30. Also check for open or short on circuit 16 BLK 32.
If voltage is missing check for open or short on circuit 16 RED 6.
Also ensure proper grounding of electric service door motor.
If circuits check good and door fails to open, replace service door motor.
Check with key in ignition switch position on, electric service door closed, step light relay removed and all other relays installed.

note.para: Always check connectors for damage and pushed-out terminals.
Always use breakout box ZTSE 4477 to take measurements on ESC connectors.

entry.para: Bench check relay. If relay fails, replace and check for faults.
Step light relay cavity 86 to ground.
If voltage is missing check for blown fuse #30 and for open or short on circuit 16 BLK 32.
If voltage is present, check for short on circuits 16 WHT 32 and A89EE.
With voltmeter still connected to open relay socket cavity 86 to 85, open electric service door by activating open electric service control circuits.
If voltage is missing check for open or short on circuits 16 WHT 33 and A89AP.
Also ensure proper signal from system controller (1600) pin 11.

note.para: Always use breakout box ZTSE 4477 to take measurements on ESC connectors.

entry.para: Step light relay cavity 30 to ground.
If voltage is missing check for open or short on circuit 16 YEL 38.

Also ensure proper voltage source from step light power source. Refer to the Step Light Power Source
section of this manual.
If voltage is missing check for open or short on circuit 16 BRN 38.
Also check ground source at step lights.
If circuits check good and service lights fail to operate, replace light fixtures.

para.emph: Vandal Lock Key Switch Voltage Checks

note.para: Always check connectors for damage and pushed-out terminals.

entry.para: Vandal lock key switch connector cavity 823 to ground.
If voltage is missing check for blown fuse #30 and for open or short on circuits 16 WHT 32 and 16 BLK 32.
Vandal lock key switch connector cavity 824 to ground.
If voltage is missing check for blown fuse #30 and for open or short on circuits 16 WHT 33 and 16 BLK 32.
If circuits check good, but vandal lock switch still fails, replace vandal lock switch.

para.title: Electric Service Door Circuits with Redundant Controls

figure.caption: Electric Service Door Control Circuits w/Redundent Control (Outputs from ESC to Door Motor) - Always Refer to the Circuit Diagram Book for Latest Circuit Information

calloutgroup.callout1: (1005) ZERO VOLT REFERENCE SPLICE CONNECTION LOCATED RIGHT SIDE INSTRUMENT PANEL
(1007) (1012) BODY BUILDER CONNECTOR LOCATED AT LEFT SIDE VEHICLE AT FLASHER PLATE
(1600) (1602) SYSTEM CONTROLLER CONNECTOR LOCATED AT INSIDE RIGHT SIDE DASH PANEL
CPC3 DASH AND TOE HARNESS TO SEALED ENGINE HARNESS
J2 FLASHER PLATE TO DASH
J17 FLASHER PLATE TO LEFT HAND BODY
J21 LEFT HAND BODY TO FRONT CAP
J22 FRONT CAP TO ENTRANCE DOOR
J140 FLASHER PLATE TO DASH AND TOE
J183 STEP LIGHT OPTIONS
SPL-40 ZERO VOLT REFERENCE SPLICE
SS4 SEALED ENGINE HARNESS TO STEP LIGHT
SS13 SEALED ENGINE HARNESS TO SKIRT LIGHT

table.title: Electric Service Door w/ Redundant Controls Circuit Tests

para.emph: Electric Service Door Open Relay Voltage Checks

entry.para: Check with key in ignition switch position on, electric service door controls set to close, open relay removed and all other relays installed.

note.para: Always check connectors for damage and pushed-out terminals.
Always use breakout box ZTSE 4477 to take measurements on ESC connectors.

entry.para: Bench check relay. If relay fails, replace and check for faults.
If voltage is missing check for blown fuse #30 and for open or short on circuit 16 BLK 32.
If voltage is present, check for short on circuits 16 WHT 32 and A89EE.
With voltmeter still connected to open relay socket cavity 86 to 85, open electric service door by activating open electric service control circuits.
If voltage is missing check for open or short on circuits 16 WHT 32 and A89EE.
Also ensure proper signal from system controller (1600) pin 11.

note.para: Always use breakout box ZTSE 4477 to take measurements on ESC connectors.

entry.para: If voltage is missing check blown fuse #30. Also check for open or short on circuit 16 BLK 32.
If voltage is missing check for open or short on circuit 16 BLU 5.
Also ensure proper grounding of electric service door motor.
If circuits check good and door fails to open, replace service door motor.

para.emph: Electric Service Door Closed Relay Voltage Checks

entry.para: Check with key in ignition switch position on, electric service door controls set to open, closed relay removed and all other relays installed.

note.para: Always check connectors for damage and pushed-out terminals.
Always use breakout box ZTSE 4477 to take measurements on ESC connectors.

entry.para: Bench check relay. If relay fails, replace and check for faults.
If voltage is missing check for blown fuse #30 and for open or short on circuit 16 BLK 32.
If voltage is present, check for short on circuits 16 WHT 33 and A89AP.
With voltmeter still connected to closed relay socket cavity 86 to 85, active closed service door circuits by pressing the close service door button.
If voltage is missing check for open or short on circuits 16 WHT 33 and A89AP.
Also ensure proper signal from system controller (1602) pin 17.

note.para: Always use breakout box ZTSE 4477 to take measurements on ESC connectors.

entry.para: If voltage is missing check blown fuse #30. Also check for open or short on circuit 16 BLK 32.
If voltage is missing check for open or short on circuit 16 RED 6.
Also ensure proper grounding of electric service door motor.
If circuits check good and door fails to open, replace service door motor.
Check with key in ignition switch position on, electric service door closed, step light relay removed and all other relays installed.

note.para: Always check connectors for damage and pushed-out terminals.
Always use breakout box ZTSE 4477 to take measurements on ESC connectors.

entry.para: Bench check relay. If relay fails, replace and check for faults.
Step light relay cavity 86 to ground.
If voltage is missing check for blown fuse #30 and for open or short on circuit 16 BLK 32.
If voltage is present, check for short on circuits 16 WHT 32 and A89EE.
With voltmeter still connected to open relay socket cavity 86 to 85, open electric service door by activating open electric service control circuits.
If voltage is missing check for open or short on circuits 16 WHT 32 and A89EE.
Also ensure proper signal from system controller (1600) pin 11.

note.para: Always use breakout box ZTSE 4477 to take measurements on ESC connectors.

entry.para: Step light relay cavity 30 to ground.
If voltage is missing check for open or short on circuit 16 YEL 38.

Also ensure proper voltage source from step light power source. Refer to the Step Light Power Source
section of this manual.
If voltage is missing check for open or short on circuit 16 BRN 38.
Also check ground source at step lights.
If circuits check good and service lights fail to operate, replace light fixtures.

para.emph: Vandal Lock Key Switch Voltage Checks

note.para: Always check connectors for damage and pushed-out terminals.

entry.para: Vandal lock key switch connector cavity 823 to ground.
If voltage is missing check for blown fuse #30 and for open or short on circuits 16 WHT 32 and 16 BLK 32.
Vandal lock key switch connector cavity 824 to ground.
If voltage is missing check for blown fuse #30 and for open or short on circuits 16 WHT 33 and 16 BLK 32.
If circuits check good, but vandal lock switch still fails, replace vandal lock switch.

para.emph: Redundant Door Control Switch (C18) Voltage Checks

entry.para: Check with key in ignition position and redundant door control switch (C18) disconnected.

note.para: Always check connectors for damage and pushed-out terminals.
Always use breakout box ZTSE 4477 to take measurements on ESC connectors.

entry.para: Redundant door control switch cavity 2 to 1.
If voltage is present or meter shows open circuit, check for open or short on circuits 16 WHT 30, 16 BLU 1, A9J, A9C, A9H, 16 WHT 6 and A89D.
Also ensure proper zero volt reference signal from system controller (1600) pin 3.
Also ensure proper input signal on system controller (1602) pin 16.

note.para: Always use breakout box ZTSE 4477 to take measurements on ESC connectors.

entry.para: Redundant door control switch cavity 2 to 3.
If voltage is present or meter shows open circuit, check for open or short on circuits 16 WHT 30, 16 BLU 1, A9J, A9C, A9H, 16 WHT 5 and A89SK.
Also ensure proper zero volt reference signal from system controller (1600) pin 3.
Also ensure proper input signal on system controller (1600) pin 26.

note.para: Always use breakout box ZTSE 4477 to take measurements on ESC connectors.

entry.para: If circuits check good and redundant door control switch still fails, replace redundant door control switch.
